snippet: The number of Kurds fleeing to Iraq from Syria has so far been small, but if Syria’s largest ethnic minority were to unite, it could shift the momentum against President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Scores of Kurds have begun to flee Syria into Iraqi Kurdistan to escape security forces and violence; growing number of refugees may signal shift in thinking among Syria's largest ethnic minority over uniting with the Sunni-dominated opposition, a move the Kurds had resisted before, which could shift the momentum against Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy and Yasir Ghazi contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The number of Kurds fleeing to Iraq from Syria has so far been small, but if Syria’s largest ethnic minority were to unite, it could shift the momentum against President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: Syrian Kurds Flee Into Iraqi Refugee Limbo
headline.main: Syrian Kurds Flee Into Iraqi Refugee Limbo
headline.print_headline: Syrian Kurds Flee Into Iraqi Refugee Limbo
